body:
MSVC/Mingw doesn't know of "hh" in "%hhX", "%02hhX", "%02hhx", "%hhu" and similar, as well as "z" in "%zu".

```
[ 79%] Building C object CMakeFiles/auto_self_conference_title_change_test.dir/auto_tests/self_conference_title_change_test.c.obj
In file included from /tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/messenger_test.c:21:0:
/tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/../testing/misc_tools.c: In function 'hex_string_to_bin':
/tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/../testing/misc_tools.c:63:25: warning: unknown conversion type character 'h' in format [-Wformat=]
         sscanf(pos, "%2hhx", &ret[i]);
                         ^
/tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/../testing/misc_tools.c:63:21: warning: too many arguments for format [-Wformat-extra-args]
         sscanf(pos, "%2hhx", &ret[i]);
                     ^~~~~~~
/tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/../testing/misc_tools.c:63:25: warning: unknown conversion type character 'h' in format [-Wformat=]
         sscanf(pos, "%2hhx", &ret[i]);
                         ^
/tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/../testing/misc_tools.c:63:21: warning: too many arguments for format [-Wformat-extra-args]
         sscanf(pos, "%2hhx", &ret[i]);
                     ^~~~~~~

                 from /tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/../toxcore/Messenger.h:28,
                 from /tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/messenger_test.c:22:
/usr/share/mingw-w64/include/winsock2.h: At top level:
/usr/share/mingw-w64/include/winsock2.h:15:2: warning: #warning Please include winsock2.h before windows.h [-Wcpp]
```

I suspect that one of such format strings corrupts memory and crashes one of the tests inside `MSVCRT_malloc()` when running it in Wine.

More specifically,

```
10/24 Test #10: messenger ........................***Failed    0.30 sec
wine: Unhandled page fault on read access to 0x0033ff58 at address 0x7bc4e2e9 (thread 0040), starting debugger...
0042:err:winediag:nodrv_CreateWindow Application tried to create a window, but no driver could be loaded.
0042:err:winediag:nodrv_CreateWindow Make sure that your X server is running and that $DISPLAY is set correctly.
Unhandled exception: page fault on read access to 0x0033ff58 in 32-bit code (0x7bc4e2e9).

=>0 0x7bc4e2e9 in ntdll (+0x3e2e9) (0x019afba4)
  1 0x7bc4e491 in ntdll (+0x3e490) (0x019afbb8)
  2 0x7bc4f614 RtlAllocateHeap+0xe3() in ntdll (0x019afc08)
  3 0x7ee44630 in msvcrt (+0x2462f) (0x019afc38)
  4 0x7ee45027 MSVCRT_malloc+0x26() in msvcrt (0x019afc58)
  5 0x00401731 hex_string_to_bin+0x20(hex_string="DB9B569D14850ED8364C3744CAC2C8FF78985D213E980C7C508D0E91E8E45441") [/tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/../testing/misc_tools.c:59] in auto_messenger_test (0x019afde8)
  6 0x0047d8bf main+0x3e(argc=<couldn't compute location>, argv=<couldn't compute location>) [/tmp/toxcore/auto_tests/messenger_test.c:352] in auto_messenger_test (0x019afde8)
  7 0x004013e3 in auto_messenger_test (+0x13e2) (0x019afec0)
  8 0x7b45fa0c call_process_entry+0xb() in kernel32 (0x019afed8)
  9 0x7b461196 in kernel32 (+0x51195) (0x019affd8)
  10 0x7b45fa1a call_process_entry+0x19() in kernel32 (0x019affec)
0x7bc4e2e9: movl	0x0(%ebx),%edi
Modules:
Module	Address			Debug info	Name (40 modules)

PE	64b40000-64bc1000	Deferred        libwinpthread-1
ELF	7b400000-7b7e7000	Dwarf           kernel32<elf>
  \-PE	7b410000-7b7e7000	\               kernel32

  \-PE	7e910000-7e92f000	\               imm32

ELF	7e959000-7e99c000	Deferred        libfontconfig.so.1
ELF	7e99c000-7e9d6000	Deferred        libpng16.so.16
ELF	7e9d6000-7e9f1000	Deferred        libz.so.1
ELF	7e9f1000-7eaa5000	Deferred        libfreetype.so.6
ELF	7eaa5000-7eadf000	Deferred        ws2_32<elf>
  \-PE	7eab0000-7eadf000	\               ws2_32
ELF	7eadf000-7eaf9000	Deferred        version<elf>
  \-PE	7eae0000-7eaf9000	\               version
ELF	7eaf9000-7ec24000	Deferred        gdi32<elf>

  \-PE	7ec40000-7ee01000	\               user32

ELF	f73b0000-f73ba000	Deferred        libnss_compat.so.2
ELF	f73bc000-f73c1000	Deferred        libdl.so.2

ELF	f75a3000-f775a000	Dwarf           libwine.so.1
ELF	f775d000-f7782000	Deferred        ld-linux.so.2
ELF	f7784000-f7785000	Deferred        [vdso].so
Threads:
process  tid      prio (all id:s are in hex)
0000000c services.exe
	00000023    0
	00000020    0
	0000000e    0
	0000000d    0
00000011 explorer.exe
	00000012    0
0000001e winedevice.exe
	00000022    0
	00000021    0
	0000001f    0
0000003f (D) Z:\tmp\toxcore\build\auto_messenger_test.exe
	00000040    0 <==
System information:
    Wine build: wine-3.2
    Platform: i386
    Version: Windows 7
    Host system: Linux
    Host version: 4.4.0-101-generic
```

That's on the second call to `hex_string_to_bin()` in  [`messenger_test.c`](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/746c624a09b3a31e7d82aa8cb945d7a6ea3fdb64/auto_tests/messenger_test.c#L352), inside `hex_string_to_bin()`'s `malloc()` call in [`misc_tools.c`](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/746c624a09b3a31e7d82aa8cb945d7a6ea3fdb64/testing/misc_tools.c#L59). It's just my guess, but is it possible that the first call to `hex_string_to_bin()` in `messenger_test.c` corrupted memory by writing over the `malloc()`'ed buffer with a `scanf()` call with unsupported format string, and then the second call to `hex_string_to_bin()` crashed in `malloc()` because of that heap memory corruption?

Anyway, regardless if that's what crashes the test on 32-bit Wine or not, if we want tests to run on Windows, which we do, we should fix the format strings.
title: Make format strings msvc/mingw-happy
